intro: Mariscus baoulensis, commonly known as the Baoulé mariscus, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
